description: n - reversal of base 2 digits of n (written in base 10).
comments: a(n) is even if n is odd and a(n) is odd if n is even; this is caused by the kind of swapping the most significant and least significant binary digit when reversing n and the fact that the most significant digit of n is always 1. - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 05 2015
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
maple: a:= proc(n) local m, r; m:=n; r:=0;      while m>0 do r:= r*2 +irem(m, 2, 'm') od;      n-r    end:seq(a(n), n=0..100);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 02 2015
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 18 2000
